titleInfo.title: Letter, 1839 July 13, Illinois Camp Ground to Brev[e]t Brig[adie]r Gen[era]l M[atthew] Arbuckle / George Lowrey ... [et al.]

mods.abstract: Copy of a letter dated July 13, 1839 from members of the Cherokee Convention to General Matthew Arbuckle regarding Arbuckle's suspicions about the nature of the convention. Arbuckle is assured by the members of the convention that they were called to assemble by the Cherokee people and that there is no cause for concern among any group of Cherokees or others. The undersigned include George Lowrey, George Guess (Sequoyah), John Ross and many others.

recordInfo.recordOrigin: This MODS record was generated into MODS v3.5 from the TEI teiHeader by University of Tennessee Libraries Digital Initiatives, using a stylesheet available at https://github.com/utkdigitalinitiatives/tei-to-mods.
